main_definition: Albuquerque is primarily known as a city in New Mexico, United States, but it can also refer to various idiomatic expressions or concepts.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A place name, specifically referring to the city of Albuquerque, New Mexico
meanings_and_examples.example: We decided to take a road trip and visited the beautiful city of Albuquerque.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An informal expression used to indicate taking unnecessary risks or making poor decisions in pursuit of an outcome
meanings_and_examples.example: He gambled his savings on a risky investment, like playing the lottery without thinking it through - he was really going all Albuquerque.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An expression used to describe doing something haphazardly or with no clear plan
meanings_and_examples.example: She tackled her project by jumping in headfirst, like she was making it up as she went along - it seemed very Albuquerque.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An idiomatic phrase to describe a situation where all possible options are exhausted
meanings_and_examples.example: They tried every method they could think of to fix the machine, but it's like they've gone through Albuquerque; there seemingly nothing left to try.
